summary:
Fields of interest: Research in fields of Postcolonial Literature, and Educational research methodologies.

For the last few years I have dedicated myself to my team and their needs. Making sure that they can work in an environment that caters to their best performance has been my main goal. I have done this by concentrating on organisational logistics, i.e. making sure their schedules are optimal, their tasks are balanced, their tasks fit their expertise, that there is a structural approach to change, that there are standard procedures in place for daily, monthly and yearly activities and  that they have the resources needed in order to be the best team they can be. 

Additionally, we have worked together on redesigning the curriculum.  We have focused on modernizing not only content but also our approach to teaching and learning. We have dedicated more time to our students individual needs, designing and implementing a strategy for students with all forms of additional needs and support. We strongly believe in the role of education in addressing societal issues and the role that our students can play in becoming agents of change.

treasury_media.title: USA Netherlands Education (UNED) symposium- AUAS & Fulbright
treasury_media.description: In this short video we introduce you to the 2017-2018 cohort of Fulbright English teaching assistants (ETA) in the Netherlands, the ETA program and the collaboration between the Fulbright Center and Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences (AUAS) English teacher training program.

treasury_media.title: UNED symposium
treasury_media.description: Highlights of the UNED symposium held at the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences in collaboration with the Fullbright Center.

education.field_of_study: International Degree in English and Education

school.name: Oxford Cambridge Royal Society of the Arts

education.field_of_study: Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages

profile_positions.description:
FACULTY OF EDUCATION, DEPARTMENT of TEACHER EDUCATION
Responsibilities:
-  Coordinator of the English teacher education programs (variants: full-time, part-time, International Degree in English and Education (phasing out), Teaching English in Bilingual schools (Pre-university three year route phasing out), one year university fast track program, and the three year intra-curricular English honors program.
-	Functional manager of a team of 39 lecturers/ teacher educators, equal to 20fte in collaboration with the head of the department.
-	Erasmus exchange program coordinator; facilitate collaborations with Erasmus partners in the UK and international office in Amsterdam. Selection of students for exchange program. Implementation of internationalization projects within the current curriculum. 
-	Fulbright ETA program coordinator; facilitate collaboration with Fulbright Center on the English Teaching Assistant program.
-	Exam coordinator; facilitate exam evaluations and checks and balances. Offer exam training for staff in matrix design, four eye evaluations and in-depth exam evaluations.
-	Member of the Amstel Campus work group scheduling.
-Member of the Amstel campus work group housing.
-	Member of the faculty logistic platform work group.
-	HVANTI ambassador; HVANTI is an organization within the HVA that invites students from the Dutch Caribbean islands to join a community of scholars that will expose them to opportunities to excel academically. Students join other students and trainers to create a positive environment for learning. As ambassador I represent HVANTI within the languages departments.
profile_positions.title: COORDINATOR OF THE ENGLISH TEACHER EDUCATION PROGRAMS

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
Chair and member of the national subject board of English teacher education, the board consists of at least one representative of each teacher education program in the Netherlands. Main activity within the board is to seek alignment within the national knowledge base.
profile_positions.title: CHAIRPERSON OF THE NATIONAL SUBJECT BOARD OF ENGLISH TEACHER EDUCATION

profile_positions.description:
FACULTY OF EDUCATION, DEPARTMENT of  TEACHER EDUCATION
Responsibilities & activities:
-	Lecture and teaching portfolio; language teaching methodology, language learning theory, educational research methodology, English literature and English language proficiency.
-	Design and development of teaching material/exams and the implementation of new curriculum requirements.
-	Organization and chairing of the work group for Modern Foreign Languages.
-	Student coach and mentor.
-	Placement supervisor.
-	Exam coordinator; facilitate exam evaluations and checks and balances. Offer exam training for staff in matrix design, four eye evaluations and in-depth exam evaluations.
-	Cambridge In-service Certificate in English Language Teaching (ICELT) assessor.
-	Assessment of prior learning assessor.
-	The supervision, guidance and support of new staff.
profile_positions.title: ENGLISH TEACHER EDUCATOR

profile_positions.description:
FACULTY OF  DIGITAL MEDIA AND CREATION, DEPARTMENT of MEDIA, INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATIONS
Responsibilities & activities:
-	Teaching of English language and proficiency modules at CEFR 0 to C1 level.
-	Development of field specific material

profile_positions.description:
Department of Entrepreneurs and Management in the Economy sector 
(Vocational Education for 16+)
Responsibilities:
-	Teaching level 1 to 4 within the vocational routes.
-	Student coach.
-	Placement supervisor.
-	Design of subject/field specific material. 
-	Design and implementation of the new curriculum.
-	Organization and chair of the Modern Foreign Languages in MBO work group.

volunteer_experiences.description: The S4 Foundation (St.Maarten Student Support Services) is an organization that facilitates the move and integration of the students of the SSS islands (St.Maarten, Saba, and St. Eustatius)  who come to the Netherlands for higher education. As a volunteer at S4 I was a member of the Regional Reception committee, and the Amsterdam reception committee.
